snippet: Many of the governments involved will face a difficult decision about whether to keep bearing the extraordinary expense.
abstract: Hunt for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 will become the most expensive search and recovery effort in aviation history; while there is an international convention that determines responsibility for air accident investigations, there are no protocols or treaties that dictate who pays, and experts say most likely case is that the countries and companies participating in the search will bear their own costs.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul, South Korea; Nicola Clark from Paris; Martin Fackler from Tokyo; Suhasini Raj from New Delhi; and Matthew L. Wald from Washington. Chen Jiehao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Many of the governments involved will face a difficult decision about whether to keep bearing the extraordinary expense.

headline.main: Search for Malaysian Jet to Be Costliest in History
headline.print_headline: Search for Malaysian Jet to Be Costliest in History
